      <item>
        <title>Tax Assistance Program</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Need tax help after April 15th?</p><p><a href="http://www.goladderup.org/">Ladder Up</a> provides free electronic preparation and e-filing of tax returns for individuals, total income up to $25,000/year, and for households, total income up to $50,000/year.</p><p>This program operates on a first come, first served basis and new clients will not be accepted the last hour.<br></p><p>More Questions? Contact the Tax Assistance Program at (312)409-4719 or e-mail  <a href="mailto:TAP@goladderup.org.%22%3ELadder%20Up.%3C/a">TAP@goladderup.org</a></p>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/5553552dbc75be0921008d5f</link>

      <item>
        <title>The Stars, Sun, Moon and Other Celestial Bodies with Linda Gorham</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Storyteller Linda Gorham loves sky stories and, like so many, loves exploring the old stories that answer the questions: "How did the sun get in the sky? Who is the man in the moon? How did one day come to be followed by one night? What do the patterns in the stars mean? Why was the Big Dipper important during the time of slavery?" Linda will share her favorite interactive folktales and myths that helped cultures all over the world explain all the wonderful things we see in the sky.<span></span></p><p>This program is for children ages 7-11 years old.</p><p><span></span></p><p><img src="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/images/full/8e84f629ba8ea9e4e1beb5cb17d3bda9/LindaGorham-closeup.jpg" style="width: 243px; height: 243px;"></p><br>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/556f1f10dd3e3f5457008384</link>

        <description><![CDATA[<p>Storyteller Linda Gorham loves sky stories and, like so many, loves exploring the old stories that answer the questions: "How did the sun get in the sky?       <item>
        <title>What if the Sky Did Fall, Chicken Little? OR Are the Planets Going to Come Tumbling Down? with Marilyn Price</title>

      <item>
        <title>INTUIT Outsider Art DIY Workshop</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Join <a href="http://www.art.org/">INTUIT: The Center for Intuitive and Outsider Art</a> for a one-hour workshop in which you will learn and talk about Outsider Art while creating a one-of-a-kind (often wearable) art piece using found and re-purposed materials.         <title>The Stars, Sun, Moon and Other Celestial Bodies with Linda Gorham</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Storyteller Linda Gorham loves sky stories and, like so many, loves exploring the old stories that answer the questions: "How did the sun get in the sky?       <item>
        <title>Adult Book Club:  Orphan Train</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Between the 1850s and 1920s, so-called "orphan trains" ran between East Coast cities and the farmlands of the Midwest, carrying thousands of homeless children whose fates would be determined largely by luck. Christina Baker Kline's <a id="ember5674" href="/item/show/8685264081" data-add-title-link="8685264081">Orphan Train</a> weaves contemporary and historical fiction in this tale about a relationship that develops between a former orphan train rider and a 17-year-old foster child.  Molly Ayer is sentenced to community service as punishment for stealing.  Her job is to help Vivian Daly, an elderly neighbor, clean out her attic.  As Molly and Vivian sort through Vivian's possessions, they find that they have a great deal in common.</p><p>Copies are available at the circulation desk.  Please visit the branch or call (312) 744-1926 for additional information.</p>]]></description>

        <title>Dar He: The Story of Emmett Til</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>This film screening is part of The Best of Black Harvest Film Festival in the Chicago Public Library, 2015.</p><p style="line-height: 22.3999996185303px;">There have been numerous treatments of the horrific 1955 murder in Mississippi of 14-year-old Chicagoan Emmett Till, but none like this stunning dramatization in which actor-writer Mike Wiley plays all 39 roles‚Äîblack, white, male, female, young, and old. Wiley's tour-de-force defamiliarizes the material with startling effectiveness and compels us to get under the skins of all the major players in the tragic events. </p><p>2012, Rob Underhill, USA, DVD projection, 70 min</p>]]></description>

      <item>
        <title>Adult Book Discussion: The 100-Year-old Man Who Climbed Out the Window and Disappeared </title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>This month we'll discuss <a id="ember3776" href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/item/show/8641781081" data-add-title-link="8641781081">The 100-year-old Man Who Climbed Out the Window and Disappeared</a>  by Jonas Jonasson. </p><p>Confined to a nursing home and about to turn 100, Allan Karlsson, who has a larger-than-life back story as an explosives expert, climbs out the window in his slippers and embarks on an unforgettable adventure involving thugs, a murderous elephant and a very friendly hot dog stand operator.</p>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/5567298dc230c80931019657</link>

        <category domain="Type">Book Clubs</category><category domain="Audience">Adults</category><category domain="Language">English</category>

      <item>
        <title>Mockumentary Screening: Schund!</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Directed by  Yael Leibovitz Zand, this clever and heartfelt mockumentary "introduces" a renowned Yiddish actor who disappeared under criminal circumstances. Left in his wake are debts, rumors and a mysterious inscription on the door of his home, reading "schund." The film's action takes place 25 years after the actor's disappearance in an effort to pick up his trail. Along the way, we meet the colorful (real) characters who made up Israel's vibrant Yiddish scene during the country's first decades. This was a period when Yiddish theater thrived even as it drew ire from an Israeli establishment bent on suppressing the threat Yiddish's popularity posed to the primacy of Hebrew culture. <br><em>Released in Israel in 2010. Runtime: 56 minutes. Hebrew and Yiddish with English subtitles.</em></p><p>This screening is presented by the <a href="http://www.chicagoyivo.org/index.php">Chicago YIVO Society</a>.</p>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/55144aa690f1157475009c59</link>

        <title>Adult Book Discussion: The Heart is a Lonely Hunter</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>The Literature and Language Book Club will discuss <a id="ember2481" data-add-title-link="1921836081" href="/item/show/1921836081">The Heart Is A Lonely Hunter</a>, by Carson McCullers. </p><p>This debut novel turned 23-year-old Carson McCullers into a literary sensation when it was first published in 1940. <span></span>Wonderfully attuned to the spiritual isolation that underlies the human condition, and with a deft sense for racial tensions in the South, McCullers spins a haunting, unforgettable story that gives voice to the rejected, the forgotten, and the mistreated -- and, through Mick Kelly, gives voice to the quiet, intensely personal search for beauty. <span></span></p>]]></description>

      <item>
        <title>Harsh Readers Circle: Blueprint For Disaster</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p> Chicago's public housing projects once had long waiting lists of would-be residents hoping to leave the slums behind. So what went wrong? To answer this complicated question, <a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/search?q=%22Hunt%2C+D.+Bradford%22&amp;search_category=author&amp;t=author">D. Bradford Hunt</a> traces public housing's history in Chicago from its New Deal roots through mayor Richard M. Daley's Plan for Transformation. In <a id="ember3324" href="/item/show/8400775081" data-add-title-link="8400775081">Blueprint for Disaster</a>, he chronicles the Chicago Housing Authority's own transformation from the city's most progressive government agency to its largest slumlord. Join the Harsh Readers Circle for a discussion of Hunt's book.<br></p>]]></description>

      <item>
        <title>Histories of the Zionist Movement: A Multi-Book Discussion</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Participants are encouraged to select and read a book-length history of the Zionist movement in anticipation of this discussion. Histories sympathetic to Zionism include <em><a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/item/show/823547081_the_siege">The Siege</a> </em>by Conor Cruise O'Brien and <em><a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/item/show/1570289081_the_zionist_ideology">The Zionist Ideology</a> </em>by Gideon Shimoni. Histories written by liberal/left Zionists include <em><a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/item/show/811752081_the_tragedy_of_zionism">The Tragedy of Zionism</a> </em>by Bernard Avishai and <em><a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/item/show/1543895081_the_founding_myths_of_israel">The Founding Myths of Israel</a> </em>by Zeev Sternhell. Histories sharply critical of Zionism include <em><a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/item/show/738041081_zionism">Zionism: False Messiah</a> </em>by Nathan Weinstock and <em><a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/item/show/1082759081_the_hidden_history_of_zionism">The Hidden History of Zionism</a> </em>by Ralph Schoenman.         <title>Money Smart: Understand Original Medicare and Medicare Supplement Insurance Plans </title>

      <item>
        <title>The Eastland Disaster</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>As the city commemorates the tragic loss of 844 lives in the 1915 Eastland Disaster, Chicago historians are re-examining the events of that day from many angles. Historian and folklorist <span class="highlight">Ursula</span> Bielski invites you to take a haunting look at Chicago's deadliest disaster, as she guides you through the "ghostlore" of the Eastland tragedy. <br><br>Strange lights and sounds on the River, apparitions in the buildings used as morgues for the unfortunate dead, and a lingering influence said to be felt by the living as they traverse the old dock site; these and other experiences have long haunted both active investigators and unwitting witnesses to the ghostly residue of the Eastland dead. </p><p> Ms. Bielski will have copies of her books available for purchase.</p>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/557701a7683b0f286201b9ca</link>

      <item>
        <title>The Pluto-New Horizons Pluto Palooza</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Pluto, the only planet discovered by an American astronomer and demoted by the IAU is being visited for the first time by the NASA New Horizons planetary robot mission. </p><p>Discover how Pluto was found, how its family of moons were discovered, the reasons the IAU decreed that Pluto be reclassified as a dwarf planet, and what we now know about Pluto as a consequence of the July 2015 New Horizons encounter with Pluto. </p><p><i>Presented by </i><i><em data-redactor-tag="em">Jim Plaxco a NASA JPL Solar System Ambassador and President of the Chicago Society for Space Studies (</em><a href="http://chicagospace.org/" target="_blank"><em>chicagospace.org</em></a><em>). Mr. Plaxco has previously served as a Vice President of the National Space Society and as a Vice President of the Planetary Studies Foundation. </em></i></p>]]></description>

        <title>Adult Mystery Book Club:  The Wicked Girls</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>In <a id="ember6848" href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/item/show/8722331081" data-add-title-link="8722331081">The Wicked Girls</a> by Alex Marwood, 25 years have passed since 11-year-old Jade Walker and Anabel Oldcastle were convicted of killing a younger girl.  After completing their juvenile confinements, they were released, given new identities, and forbidden to see each other. Amber Gordon works as a cleaner at Funnland, an amusement park, and Kirsty Lindsay comes to town to cover the murders.    This thriller is as full of twists, turns, and surprises as the hall of mirrors where one of the bodies is found.</p><p>Copies are available at the branch's Circulation Desk.         <title>Lunar Lander Aerospace Engineering with Engineering for Kids</title>

      <item>
        <title>Marlon T. Riggs Film Retrospective--The Shorts</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Riggs' short films include:</p><ul><li>Anthem (9 minutes) is an experimental music video asserting a defiant homoeroticism of African American male sexuality.</li><li>Affirmations (10 minutes) explores black male dreams and desires and is framed by the poetry of Essex Hemphill.</li><li>Non, Je Ne Regrette Rien (No Regrets) (38 minutes) is a poetic and intimate film presenting moving testimonials and portraits of five black gay men.  They each disclose their HIV+ status and how they fiercely combat the stigma around the disease.  Marlon Riggs died with HIV/AIDS in 1994 and was dedicated to confronting the urgency of the AIDS epidemic in African American communities, especially among black gay men.</li></ul>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/555377c1bc75be0921009885</link>

      <item>
        <title>Adult Classic Book Club:  Light in August</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>William Faulkner is a giant figure in American literature.  Using the South as his inspiration and setting, Faulkner wrote a series of novels and stories which reflect universal human truths and conditions; he won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1951 and is regarded as one of the greatest of American novelists. </p><p>Originally published in 1932, <a id="ember25404" href="/item/show/1001991081" data-add-title-link="1001991081">Light in August</a>, considered to be his most accessible novel, weaves together multiple plotlines and a large cast of characters to explore issues of race, class, gender, and identity in the American South.  </p><p>Copies are available at the branch's Circulation Desk.  Please visit the branch or call (312) 744-1926 for additional information.</p>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/5589ac31dd3e3f54570513e2</link>

      <item>
        <title>Thinking Critically About Israel/Palestine: A Conversation with Moishe Postone</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Discussion about the ongoing conflict in Israel/Palestine has become increasingly polarized between positions that present themselves as either "pro-Israel" or "pro-Palestine." Such frequently dualistic thinking, argues University of Chicago-based historian <a href="https://history.uchicago.edu/directory/moishe-postone">Moishe Postone</a>, is part of what renders the history of that conflict a seemingly impossible subject to discuss in the present. Professor Postone discusses how we might get beyond an either/or approach by analyzing the trajectories of politics <em>within </em>Israel and politics <em>within</em> Palestine over recent decades. He also considers where Zionism has been variously understood to fall within the Left-Right political spectrum, both before and after the creation of the state of Israel.</p>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/557ef31135aff90052031df6</link>

        <title>Adult Book Discussion: We Are All Completely Beside Ourselves by Karen Joy Fowler</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Rosemary Cooke, the youngest, tells the story of her family; her sister Fern, her older brother Lowell, her psychologist father, and her mother. It's an unusual story because Fern, virtually the same age as Rosemary, lives for the first five years of her life as part of an experiment to learn the effects of being raised within a human family‚Äî and the effect having a non-human "sister" has on Rosemary.         <title>Avalon Odeum</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p><img src="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/images/full/a34364d06e62941d56fec56f3e9cc071/LawThesePartsPOV.jpg" unselectable="on"></p><p>Film screening: <em>The Law in These Parts</em></p> <i><em data-redactor-tag="em">The Law in These Parts by Ra'anan Alexandrowicz </em></i>examines the system of military administration used by Israel since the Six Day War of 1967. In a series of thoughtful and candid interviews, Israeli judges, prosecutors and legal advisors, who helped devise the occupation's legal framework, paint a complex picture of the Middle East conflict and the balance among political interests, security and human rights that has come with it. This event is a collaboration with the award-winning documentary series <a href="http://www.pbs.org/pov">POV</a>.<p><br>(Photo: Alexander Ramati (Lieutenant Colonel, Retired) Legal Advisor, West Bank Military COmmand 1973-1979; Military Judge 1980-1981.         <title>Far Out Songs About Space with Rick Kelley</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Blast off with musician Rick Kelley as you sing along to some brand new songs such as "The Solar System Song", "I Can be an Astronaut" and "Super Nova", a song all about stars.       <item>
        <title>Short Films Screening: Best of Black Harvest Film Festival</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p><strong>Bathroom Attendant </strong>- A charming bathroom attendant at risk of losing his job due to new management teaches us that sometimes there's more to a job than just tending to the needs of customers.</p><p><strong>Perfect Day </strong>- Desmond, a loner in a volatile high school, has devised a plan to reveal his affections to Aasha.  Then in the midst of the days chaos, he discovers he has a secret admirer.  All concerns fade as he makes his way from clue to clue to find who is leaving him notes. He questions if he will ever find love or as the tension escalates, a safe way home.</p><p><strong>Daughter of Fortune</strong> - In the late summer of 1955, Hollywood star Cynthia Beckley has everything. But when her estranged sister dies, Cynthia's long buried secrets threaten to reappear and destroy.</p><p><strong>Strange Fruit</strong> - In 1930 a Jewish teacher wrote a protest song about two African American teenagers that were lynched. The song became a signature of Billie Holiday. This is the story of an American masterpiece, the song <em>TIME </em>magazine called in 1999 "the song of the century."</p><p><strong>About Taking Over, Taking Back</strong> - The foreclosure crisis hit Chicago hard, it left 62,000 vacant properties in a city with more than 100,000 people living on the street. An organization works to put displaced families into foreclosed  homes and rebuild the communities. This documentary was shot in Chicago by student filmmakers.</p>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/559170c5dd3e3f5457065e6a</link>

      <item>
        <title>Newspaper Genealogical Resources</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Learn to use CPL's historical Chicago newspapers, city directories, phone books and equipment to find obituaries, news items, and addresses for your Chicago ancestors.</p><p>Rare Chicago newspapers from as far back as the 1850s may contain information about your Chicago ancestors you can't find anywhere else!</p><p>Participants will learn to search the <i>Chicago Tribune</i>, <i>Chicago Defender</i>, <i>Chicago Sun-Times</i>, and <em>Chicago Examiner </em>databases for obituaries and other news items. There will also be a demonstration of how to use microfilm to access many other Chicago newspapers that aren't available online.</p><p> Seating is limited. First come, first served.<br></p>]]></description>

        <title>Job Searching with a Mental Health and/or Substance Abuse Disorder</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Are you unemployed, and do you have a mental health and/or a substance abuse disorder? Would you like assistance with obtaining competitive, gainful employment? This seminar discusses how an IPS Supported Employment Program can help you! IPS Supported Employment Programs are offered by various not-for-profit organizations based in the Chicago area, including <a href="http://www.trilogyinc.org/">Trilogy</a>, <a href="http://www.thresholds.org/">Thresholds</a>, <a href="https://www.pillarscommunity.org/">Pillars</a>, and <a href="http://www.search-inc.org/">Search Inc</a>. These organizations provide services designed specifically for job-seekers facing mental health and/or substance abuse disorders. The services provided may include individualized career planning and guidance, peer support, and access to community-based mental health and substance abuse assistance. This seminar is presented by Brad Rosner, an IPS Recovery Support Specialist at <a href="http://www.trilogyinc.org/">Trilogy Behavioral Healthcare</a>.<span></span></p>]]></description>

        <title>Book Discussion: Short Nights of the Shadow Catcher: The Epic Life and Immortal Photographs of Edward Curtis</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Edward Curtis was dashing, charismatic, a passionate mountaineer, a famous photographer--the Annie Liebowitz of his time. He was thirty-two years old in 1900 when he gave it all up to pursue his great idea, he would try to capture on film the Native American nation before it disappeared. At once an incredible adventure narrative and a penetrating biographical portrait, <a id="ember7489" href="/item/show/8637003081" data-add-title-link="8637003081">Short Nights of the Shadow Catcher<span></span></a><span></span> tells the remarkable untold story behind Curtis's iconic photographs, following him throughout Indian country from desert to rainforest as he struggled to document the stories and rituals of more than eighty tribes. </p><br>]]></description>

      <item>
        <title>Book Discussion: Short Nights of the Shadow Catcher: The Epic Life and Immortal Photographs of Edward Curtis</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Edward Curtis was dashing, charismatic, a passionate mountaineer, a famous photographer--the Annie Liebowitz of his time. He was thirty-two years old in 1900 when he gave it all up to pursue his great idea, he would try to capture on film the Native American nation before it disappeared. At once an incredible adventure narrative and a penetrating biographical portrait, <a id="ember7489" href="/item/show/8637003081" data-add-title-link="8637003081">Short Nights of the Shadow Catcher<span></span></a><span></span> tells the remarkable untold story behind Curtis's iconic photographs, following him throughout Indian country from desert to rainforest as he struggled to document the stories and rituals of more than eighty tribes. </p><br>]]></description>

      <item>
        <title>Women Heroes of World War I</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>The years leading up to the Great War witnessed a global intensifying of both nationalism and suffragist endeavors. When the war mobilized women worldwide, some of their contributions became powerful symbols in their government's propaganda efforts as well as in women's rights movements. Kathryn Atwood, author of <a id="ember3191" data-add-title-link="8815083081" href="/item/show/8815083081">Women Heroes of World War I</a>, will highlight the stories of women whose wartime work was utilized in these two ways.         <title>Adult Book Discussion: The Love Affairs of Nathaniel P. by Adelle Waldman</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Writer Nate Piven's star is rising. After several lean and striving years, he has his pick of both magazine assignments and women:  Juliet, the hotshot business reporter; Elisa, his gorgeous ex-girlfriend, now friend; and Hannah, "almost universally regarded as nice and smart, or smart and nice," who holds her own in conversation with his friends.  In this debut novel, Waldman plunges into the psyche of a flawed, sometimes infuriating modern man.  Nate thinks of himself as beyond superficial judgment, yet constantly struggles with his own status anxiety.       <item>
        <title>Money Smart: Questions about Medicare Part C?  Learn about Medicare Advantage Plans.</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>  Medicare has a plan that will cover your hospital &amp; medical insurance (Parts A &amp; B) and many of these plans also offer prescription drug coverage (this plan type is called Medicare Advantage Prescription Drug-MAPD).       <item>
        <title>Senior Summer Book Series: The Paris Wife by Paula McLain</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Chicago, 1920: Hadley Richardson is a quiet 28 year old who has all but given up on love and happiness-until she meets Ernest Hemingway.  Following a whirlwind courtship and wedding, the pair set sail for Paris, where they become the golden couple in a lovely and volatile group the fabled "Lost Generation" that includes Gertrude Stein, Ezra Pound and F. Scott Fitzgerald.  Though deeply in love, the Hemingways are ill prepared for the hard-drinking, fast-living and free-loving life of Jazz Age Paris. A heartbreaking portrayal of love and torn loyalty, <a id="ember24008" href="/item/show/8529780081" data-add-title-link="8529780081">The Paris Wife</a> is all the more poignant because Hemingway wrote that he would rather have died than have fallen in love with anyone but Hadley.  Copies are available at the Portage-Cragin Branch.</p>]]></description>

      <item>
        <title>Harsh Readers Circle: Black Against Empire</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Join the Harsh Readers Circle for a discussion of <a id="ember7648" href="/item/show/8672166081" data-add-title-link="8672166081">Black Against Empire</a>: The History and Politics of the Black Panther Party. Author <a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/search?q=%22Bloom%2C+Joshua%22&amp;search_category=author&amp;t=author">Joshua Bloom</a> offers the first comprehensive overview and analysis of the history and politics of the Black Panther Party. The authors analyze key political questions, such as why so many young black people across the country risked their lives for the revolution, why the Party grew most rapidly during the height of repression, and why allies abandoned the Party at its peak of influence. Bold, engrossing, and richly detailed, this book cuts through the mythology and obfuscation, revealing the political dynamics that drove the explosive growth of this revolutionary movement, and its disastrous unraveling. Informed by twelve years of meticulous archival research, as well as familiarity with most of the former Party leadership and many rank-and-file members, this book is the definitive history of one of the greatest challenges ever posed to American state power.</p>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/55561d529fdaf8f96c019750</link>
        <guid>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/55561d529fdaf8f96c019750</guid>                <bc:start_date>2015-09-19T19:00:00Z</bc:start_date>

      <item>

        <description><![CDATA[<p>Ifemelu and Obinze are young and in love when they depart military-ruled Nigeria for the West.  Beautiful, self-assured Ifemelu heads for America, where despite her academic success she is forced to grapple with what it means to be black for the first time.  Quiet, thoughtful Obinze had hoped to join her, but with post-9/11 America closed to him, he instead plunges into a dangerous, undocumented life in London.       <item>
        <title>Looking for a job? Government and non-profit programs can help!</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Did you know there are government-funded programs available to help anyone who is actively searching for employment or seeking to receive professionally accredited training in many technical areas? Are you aware that these services are free of charge though neighborhood non-profit organizations? For many job-seekers, there are programs that help with resume creation, job search assistance, and interviewing techniques. Additionally, many companies contact these organizations in their search for new candidates. This workshop covers what programs are available, how to go about applying for them, and what they can do to make your career transition as short as possible. This workshop is presented by Matthew Mischnick, a project coordinator within the Department of Workforce Development for the <a href="http://www.apcc-chgo.org/">Albany Park Community Center</a>.</p>]]></description>

      <item>
        <title>Harsh Readers Circle: Eye on the Struggle</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>James McGrath Morris<u></u>'s new biography of pioneering journalist Ethel Payne illustrates how African American reporters shaped and were shaped by the freedom struggle. <a id="ember10887" href="/item/show/8861431081" data-add-title-link="8861431081">Eye on the Struggle</a>: Ethel Payne, the First Lady of the Black Press examines the details of Ethel Payne's groundbreaking journalism career with the <em>Chicago Defender</em>. She became the first black female radio and television commentator, working for CBS. She was the first black reporter to cover the Vietnam War. She toured China in 1973 with a group that included Susan Sontag. In 2002, a little more than a decade after her death, she appeared on a United States postage stamp. Mr. Morris charts the arc of Ms. Payne's remarkable career while attending to the human details of her story. Enjoy the book, then join the Harsh Readers Circle for a discussion.</p>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/55561da69fdaf8f96c019755</link>

      <item>
        <title>Harsh Readers Circle: Louis Armstrong</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Louis Armstrong was the founding father of jazz and one of this century's towering cultural figures. The musical talents of Satchmo - as Armstrong became universally known - were prodigious and groundbreaking. Author <a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/search?q=%22Bergreen%2C+Laurence%22&amp;search_category=author&amp;t=author">Lawrence Bergreen</a> offers a comprehensive and substantial biography of this talented musician in <a id="ember2426" href="/item/show/1402064081" data-add-title-link="1402064081">Louis Armstrong:</a> An Extravagant Life.       <item>
        <title>Harsh Readers Circle: Hair Story</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Join the Harsh Readers Circle for a discussion of <a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/search?&amp;t=author&amp;search_category=author&amp;q=Byrd%2C%20Ayana%20D%20">Ayana D. Byrd</a> and <a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/search?&amp;t=author&amp;search_category=author&amp;q=Lori%20L.%20Tharps'%20">Lori L. Tharps'</a> book on   the culture behind the ever-changing state of Black hair-from fifteenth century Africa to the present-day United States. <a id="ember4428" href="/item/show/8759784081" data-add-title-link="8759784081">Hair Story:</a> Untangling the Roots of Black Hair in America explains to readers that the hair we grow and the styles we wear it in say something significant about who we are, where we've come from and where we hope to go.   While many realize that when it comes to black hair, there is much, much more historical and cultural significance than meets the eye. It takes a deep study like this one, however, to reveal what our hair says about ourselves and our society.</p>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/555a28c27b253bb0780155ac</link>

      <item>
        <title>Harsh Readers Circle: America&#39;s Mistress</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Eartha Kitt was the daughter of a black woman and a white man at a time when white women dominated the airwaves. She was undeniably attractive, but not conventionally beautiful. Kitt wasn't a particularly gifted singer, but she had her own immediately identifiable sound. What made her famous was a persona that radiated what we would today call "attitude." Author John L. Williams offers readers a fast-paced, well-written and exhaustively researched book with <a id="ember6437" href="/item/show/8829309081" data-add-title-link="8829309081">America's Mistress</a>: The Life and Times of Eartha Kitt. Join the Harsh Readers Circle for a discussion of this exciting biography. <br></p><p><br></p>]]></description>

      <item>
        <title>Harsh Research Collection: Gateway to Freedom</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>Author <a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/search?q=%22Foner%2C+Eric%22&amp;search_category=author&amp;t=author">Eric Foner</a>, Pulitzer Prize winner and history professor at Columbia University, offers a new story that will surprise most readers. A big surprise in <a id="ember8287" href="/item/show/8855445081" data-add-title-link="8855445081">Gateway to Freedom</a><em>: </em>The Hidden History of the Underground Railroad's<em> </em>is that, despite the book's subtitle, the Underground Railroad often was not hidden at all. People boldly helped raise money for the "Railroad" and hid runaway slaves. <span class="drop-cap">F</span><span class="smallcaps">oner's compelling narrative </span>centers on New York City, another un&shy;expected twist. Unlike Boston and Philadelphia, with their deep-rooted reformist traditions‚Äî&shy;and unlike such upstate cities as Buffalo and Syracuse‚Äîthe metropolis was hardly known for abolitionist fervor. Building on fresh evidence including a detailed record of slave escapes secretly kept by Sydney Howard Gay, one of the key organizers in New York Foner elevates the underground railroad from folklore to detailed history. The story is inspiring full of memorable characters making their first appearance on the historical stage. It eventually took a civil war to destroy American slavery, but here at last is the story of the courageous effort to fight slavery by "practical abolition." Join the Harsh Readers Circle for a thoughtful discussion of this work.</p>]]></description>
        <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/555a2b1b7b253bb078015635</link>

      <item>
        <title>Harsh Readers Circle: The GQ Candidate</title>
        <description><![CDATA[<p>"<a id="ember10137" href="/item/show/8553711081" data-add-title-link="8553711081">The GQ Candidate</a><em></em> gives readers a behind-the-scenes look at what happens in the lives of candidates, and the people closest to them, when the cameras aren't rolling. In addition to the story of the campaign, the novel also follows the lives of Luke's tight knit circle of friends and reveals how his amazing race changes their lives forever." -Goodreads</p><p>Join the Harsh Readers Circle for a discussion of political analyst <a href="https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/search?&amp;t=author&amp;search_category=author&amp;q=Goff%2C%20Keli%20">Keli Geoff's</a> debut novel about a  charismatic African American/Jewish governor who runs for President of the United States.         <link>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/555a2b557b253bb07801563a</link>
        <guid>https://chipublib.bibliocommons.com/events/555a2b557b253bb07801563a</guid>                <bc:start_date>2016-05-21T19:00:00Z</bc:start_date>
        <bc:end_date>2016-05-21T21:00:00Z</bc:end_date>
        <bc:is_cancelled>false</bc:is_cancelled>
        <bc:is_featured>false</bc:is_featured>
        <bc:is_featured_at_location>false</bc:is_featured_at_location>
